title: Economic Recovery Loan
description: Subordinate (gap) financing up to $300,000 to assist businesses in their efforts to remain viable and/or improve productivity.

title: Intermediary Relending Program
description: Gap financing to help rural small businesses with any prudent business activity.  Loans may to exceed 75% of project cost up to a maximum loan amount of $250,000.

title: Kim Wallace Adaptive Equipment Loan Program Fund
description: Financial assistance to disabled persons and businesses for the purchase, construction or installation of adaptive products or equipment that allow disabled persons to become more independent within the community, promotes mobility and improves independence and quality of life. Businesses may use loan funds to facilitate compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).

title: Energy Conservation Loan
description: Low-interest loans to improve energy efficiency in Maine workplaces.

title: Regional Economic Development Revolving Loan Program for Day Care
description: Loans up to $100,000 for child care projects or physical site improvements.

title: Regional Economic Development Revolving Loan Program
description: Loans made through regional economic development agencies to businesses that have sales under $5,000,000 or employ 50 or fewer employees, and conducting business in the following categories: manufacturing, information systems, biotechnology, natural resources, defense, export, scientific and technology R&D, micro-businesses (under 5 employees), and child care projects.

title: Small Enterprise Growth Fund
description: Provides venture capital to Maine based companies in almost all industry sectors, though the return potential of the investment must be high enough to justify the risk taken.

title: Agricultural Marketing Loan Fund
description: Low cost financing to help farmers, food processors and aquaculture operations adopt new and innovative equipment and facilities in order to improve and enhance the manufacturing, marketability and production of Maine products.

title: Potato Marketing Improvement Fund
description: Low-cost financing to help potato growers and packers improve the quality and marketing of Maine potatoes.

title: Nutrient Management Loan Program
description: Low-interest loan program to fund the construction and improvement of livestock manure and milk room waste containment/handling facilities, including associated costs of design and engineering of these facilities, as well as the cost of related equipment that meets the goal of the State's Nutrient Management Plan.

title: Oil Storage Facility and Tank Program
description: Low-interest, fixed-rate financing for the removal, disposal and replacement of aboveground and underground commercial storage tanks, piping and related equipment associated with the tank, as well as the purchase and installation of vapor recovery systems.

title: Wells and Plymouth Waste Oil Clean-Up Program
description: Financing for response costs incurred by eligible applicants for the investigation, removal and remediation of contamination at the Portland - Bangor Waste Oil Services sites in Wells and Plymouth, Maine.

title: Major Business Expansion Bond Program
description: Provides long-term, credit-enhanced financing up to $25,000,000 at taxable bond rates for businesses creating or retaining 50 jobs and long-term, tax-exempt bond rates on bonds of up to $10,000,000 that are used to finance manufacturing expansions.

title: Revenue Obligations Securities Program
description: Provides manufacturing borrowers with State access to tax-exempt bond financing and is ideally suited when the borrower proposes to arrange its own credit enhancement.

title: Secondary Market Taxable Bond Program
description: Provides long-term bond financing on loans of for real estate and machinery and equipment acquisitions. Loan amount available up to 90% of the project debt. FAME exposure to any one relationship may not exceed $4,750,000.

title: Secondary Market Tax-Exempt Bond Program
description: Provides tax-exempt interest rate bond financing for manufacturing borrowers. Loan amount available up to 90% of the project debt. FAME exposure to any one relationship may not exceed $4,750,000.

title: Major Business Expansion Bond Program
description: Provides long-term, credit-enhanced financing up to $25,000,000 at taxable bond rates for businesses creating or retaining 50 jobs and long-term, tax-exempt bond rates on bonds of up to $10,000,000 that are used to finance manufacturing expansions.

title: Revenue Obligations Securities Program
description: Provides manufacturing borrowers with State access to tax-exempt bond financing and is ideally suited when the borrower proposes to arrange its own credit enhancement.

title: Secondary Market Taxable Bond Program
description: Provides long-term bond financing on loans of for real estate and machinery and equipment acquisitions. Loan amount available up to 90% of the project debt. FAME exposure to any one relationship may not exceed $4,750,000.

title: Secondary Market Tax-Exempt Bond Program
description: Provides tax-exempt interest rate bond financing for manufacturing borrowers. Loan amount available up to 90% of the project debt. FAME exposure to any one relationship may not exceed $4,750,000.
